parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the ABS HCU can cause the brake system to malfunction, leading to a loss of braking power, which can result in accidents, injuries, or fatalities.
symptoms: Rear brake pedal becomes hard or frozen
front brake lever becomes hard or frozen
brake pedal does not return to its normal position

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: ABS System Failure due to Moisture in the Fluid
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the ABS system due to moisture in the fluid can cause the brake system to malfunction, leading to a loss of braking power, which can result in accidents, injuries, or fatalities.
symptoms: Rear brake pedal becomes hard or frozen
front brake lever becomes hard or frozen
brake pedal does not return to its normal position

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the throttle-by-wire system can cause the motorcycle to lose throttle response, leading to a sudden loss of speed, which can increase the risk of accidents, especially in heavy traffic.
symptoms: The motorcycle suddenly loses throttle response
the engine RPM is limited to 1000 RPM
the check engine light comes on

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the compensator sprocket can cause the rear wheel to lock, leading to loss of control, accidents, and potentially serious injury or death.
symptoms: and potential failure at high speeds.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Premature failure of the front wheel bearing can cause the wheel to wobble or vibrate, leading to a loss of control and increasing the risk of accidents, especially at high speeds.
symptoms: Excessive play in the front wheel
rough movement of the front wheel
front wheel wobble when crossing over bridge joints or other road imperfections
vibration or shaking of the front wheel.
